001package io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.spring;
002
003import java.util.Arrays;
004import java.util.Objects;
005import org.springframework.context.ConfigurableApplicationContext;
006import org.springframework.context.annotation.AnnotationConfigApplicationContext;
007import org.springframework.lang.NonNull;
008import org.springframework.test.context.ContextCustomizer;
009import org.springframework.test.context.MergedContextConfiguration;
010
011/**
012 * A custom Spring {@link ContextCustomizer} that scans additional base packages for Spring components.
013 *
014 * <p>This class is used to dynamically include extra packages during the Spring context initialization,
015 * ensuring that relevant beans and configurations are detected. It is particularly useful when
016 * extending the test context beyond the default package scanning.
017 *
018 * <p>The customizer is applied by scanning the specified {@code basePackages} in an
019 * {@link AnnotationConfigApplicationContext}, enabling the framework to discover and register additional beans
020 * for test execution.
021 *
022 * <p>Instances of this class compare equality based on the {@code basePackages} array, ensuring that
023 * duplicate customizers are not applied unnecessarily.
024 *
025 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
026 */
027public class FrameworkAdapterContextCustomizer implements ContextCustomizer {
028
029   private final String[] basePackages;
030
031   /**
032    * Creates a new {@code FrameworkAdapterContextCustomizer} with the specified base packages.
033    *
034    * @param basePackages The packages to scan for Spring components.
035    *                     Must not be {@code null}.
036    */
037   public FrameworkAdapterContextCustomizer(String[] basePackages) {
038      this.basePackages = Objects.requireNonNull(basePackages, "Base packages must not be null");
039   }
040
041   /**
042    * Customizes the given Spring application context by scanning the specified base packages.
043    *
044    * @param context      The configurable application context.
045    * @param mergedConfig The merged context configuration.
046    */
047   @Override
048   public void customizeContext(@NonNull ConfigurableApplicationContext context,
049                                @NonNull MergedContextConfiguration mergedConfig) {
050      if (context instanceof final AnnotationConfigApplicationContext annotationContext) {
051         annotationContext.scan(basePackages);
052      }
053   }
054
055   /**
056    * Compares this customizer to another object, returning {@code true} if they share the same base packages.
057    *
058    * @param obj The object to compare.
059    * @return {@code true} if both customizers have the same {@code basePackages}, otherwise {@code false}.
060    */
061   @Override
062   public boolean equals(Object obj) {
063      if (this == obj) {
064         return true;
065      }
066      if (!(obj instanceof final FrameworkAdapterContextCustomizer other)) {
067         return false;
068      }
069      return Arrays.equals(basePackages, other.basePackages);
070   }
071
072   /**
073    * Returns the hash code of this customizer, based on the {@code basePackages}.
074    *
075    * @return The hash code.
076    */
077   @Override
078   public int hashCode() {
079      return Arrays.hashCode(basePackages);
080   }
081
082   /**
083    * Returns a string representation of this customizer, including the {@code basePackages}.
084    *
085    * @return A string describing the customizer.
086    */
087   @Override
088   public String toString() {
089      return "FrameworkAdapterContextCustomizer{" + "basePackages=" + Arrays.toString(basePackages) + '}';
090   }
091
092}
